title: Broadcaster || MLB Info - Desktop Layout
custom_steps:
As a Broadcaster, I want to know who to contact in case of emergency, so that we can work to solve my problem.


1. Desktop wireframe implemented

2. *Transmission Trouble Number* displays.
a. Does not phone call when clicked. 

3. Contents of Admin WYSIWYG displays in Phone's window size.
a. All hyperlinks work as expected.
b. All attachments display as expected.

title: Broadcaster || MLB Info - Mobile Layout
custom_steps:

1. Mobile wireframe implemented

3. Contents of Admin WYSIWYG displays in Phone’s window size.

title: Admin || Settings - Client Broadcaster profile - Update "Restricted Broadcaster" Field to "Network Rights"
custom_steps:
*AC*

* Restricted Broadcasters is updated to Network Rights.
* Dropdown displays all Networks that have {{Restricted}} checked in their Network profile.
* Dropdown is multi-select.
* Networks selected in this field display in _Preferred Network_ dropdown for associated Client Broadcaster when Network is assigned to a game.(by Dewey)

title: Admin || Settings - Network Profile - Add Restricted Checkbox
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to note whether a Network is restricted, so that only people with rights to the Network can access the Network in their Preferred Network dropdown.

*AC*

* Checkbox with field name _Restricted_ displays in General Information section of Network Profile.

Signage Path table does not save duplicates.

title: Admin || Settings - Updates to Client Broadcaster Profile
custom_steps:
In Client Broadcaster Profile - Check the following updates:

# *Previous* 
Displayed Broadcaster Alias
Displayed Decoder Permission Override
Displayed Allow Pre-Finalization
Displayed In Demand
Displayed the Decoder table

# *Current*
Removed Broadcaster Alias
Removed Decoder Permission Override
Removed Auto-Finalization
Removed In Demand
Hide the Decoder table

title: Admin || Settings - Build "Edit Client Broadcaster Page" Into the Rules Engine
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to ensure that rules set in a Client Broadcasterâ€™s profile help determine their permissions within Intl BATTER.



*AC*

General Information section puts the following rules in place:
*Is Active* 
* When checked, all users associated with the broadcaster can submit a game request.
* When unchecked, all users associated with the broadcaster can NOT submit a game request.


Programming & Decoders section puts the following rules in place:
*Allow Multiple Per-Game Bookings*
* If checked, allow all users associated with this broadcaster to place multiple requests for the same game, with different Preferred Networks.  (MUST RIGHT-CLICK SCHEDULE)
* NOTE: This allows the client broadcaster to select multiple feeds for the same game
* If unchecked, place a restriction of one game request per game on all users associated with this broadcaster.

*Allow Auto-Approval*
* If checked, game requests placed by all users associated with this broadcaster skip _Pending_ and go straight to _Engineering_.
* If unchecked, game requests placed by all users associated with this broadcaster flow through the typical status flow (ie begin in _Pending_).

All users associated with the Broadcaster will have rules around their requests as marked in the client broadcaster profile.
Possible Conflicts rules apply to their requesting permissions.
Applicable Rules Check rules apply to their requesting permissions.

title: Admin || Settings - Update Transmit Circuits to Transmit
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to change the name of the Transmit Circuits table, so that the name is reflective of all types of Transmit delivery methods.

*AC*

*Transmit Circuit* table name is updated to *Transmit* everywhere.

title: Admin || Settings - Make Region Not Required On Edit Client Broadcaster Page
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I don't want the Region field to be required in a Client Broadcaster's profile, because it's not a heavily used field.


*AC*

*Admins can save Client Broadcaster profiles without filling out the {{Region}} field.*

title: Admin || Settings - Edit a Network Functionality
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to edit a Network's profile, so that I can maintain accurate information on each Network.

Zeplin Link: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e359493a3f09ded91d2e8b] 


*AC*

Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.

* All fields appear under corresponding subsections.
* All fields accept/display values as described in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2174].
* "expand all" expands all menu items.
* Upon changes being made, "Save" button will display next to "Cancel" button.
* All Networks edits are accessible across all Network fields in Intl BATTER.

title: Admin || Settings - Network Profile Functionality
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to edit a Networkâ€™s profile, so that I can maintain accurate information on each Network.

Zeplin Link: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e359493a3f09ded91d2e8b] 


*AC*
# Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.
# _General Information_ section is read only.
* Data piped into these fields references Broadcast Source table from Domestic BATTER.
# _Technical Details_ section
* Is entirely free form text fields, barring {{Decoder Required}}.
* *Decoder Required* is a dropdown menu of all entries in the Decoder Models Config table.
* Accepts all inputs (letters, numbers, special characters, etc.)
# _Contacts_ section
* Is entirely free form text fields.
* Accepts all inputs (letters, numbers, special characters, etc.)
# _Audio & Feed_ section
* Defaults to four Audio fields.
* Audio 1, Audio 2, Audio 3, and Audio 4 auto-populate from the selected _Preferred Network's profile to their respective fields in the approval drawer.
* Only Audios 1-4 auto-populate, any additional audios will not populate to the approval drawer.
* "add audio" creates an identical _Audio X_ field where X represents the next sequential number.
* The number of Audio fields in a Network profile matches the number of Audio fields in any Request drawer involving that Network.
* The _trash icon_ deletes its corresponding row value.
* Deletes the entire row if there are more than four fields displayed.
* Numbers update to reflect the condensed sequence.
* Values/rows can be removed, without affecting previous requests.
* All other fields are free form text fields.
* Accepts all inputs (letters, numbers, special characters, etc.)
# _Encryption & Decoders_ sectionâ€¦
* "BISS Key" is a free form text field.
* Accepts all inputs (letters, numbers, special characters, etc.).
* _Decoders_ subsection is a series of dropdowns that reference the _Decoder Model_ table.
* Defaults to one row.
* All options included in the dropdown will exist as an entry in the _Decoder Model_ table.
* "add a decoder" adds a new field with the existing decoder drop down logic.
*  The _trash icon_ deletes its corresponding row.
# Networks added are accessible across all "Network" fields in Intl BATTER.
# All changes made to a Network profile will be reflected across associated "Network" fields in Intl BATTER.



NOTE: When converting Network Profile information to HTML, certain special characters may need to be accounted for so as not to break the produced email.

title: Admin || Settings - Edit Client Broadcasters Layout
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to edit a client broadcaster profile, so that we can stay up-to-date with our broadcaster information.

Zeplin: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960] 


*AC*

# General Information section displays and has required fields
* Broadcaster Name
* Is Active
 
# Programming & Decoders displays and has fields
* Transmission Method  (required)
* Allow Multiple Per-Game Bookings
* Allow Auto Approval 

# Preferred Destinations section displays and has fields
* Format Preference 
* Destinations 

# Contract section displays and has fields
* Contract Dropdown
* "create new contract" button
## Info subsection displays with fields
* Region (required)
* Non-Exclusivity 
* Extra Innings 
## General Restrictions subsection displays with fields
* Games per Week 
* Games per Month 
* Games per Season 
## Special Rules subsection displays with
* Special Rule field
* Trash icon to the right of the field.
* "add rule" button
## Regular Season Days of the Week Restrictions subsection displays with fields
* Days with Restrictions 
* Fully Restricted
* Before
* After
* # of Total Games
* Jewel Event Broadcast Rights displays.
* Restricted Broadcasters displays.
* Shows field displays.
* Countries field displays.
* Country search bar displays.

title: Admin || Settings - Edit Client Broadcasters Data Population
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to edit a client broadcaster profile, so that we can stay up-to-date with our broadcaster information.

Zeplin: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960|https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960|smart-link] 



*AC*

# General Information section displays and has required fields
a. {{Broadcaster Name}} is a string.
b. {{Is Active}} is a Boolean Flag.
# Programming & Decoders has fields
a. {{Transmission Method}} is required.

* Dropdown populated by _Transmission Method_ table.

b. Allow Multiple Per-Game Bookings is a Boolean Flag.
c. Allow Auto Approval is a Boolean Flag.

# Preferred Destinations section has fields
a. Format Preference dropdown populated by _Transmit Formats_ table.
b. Destinations dropdown populated by _Transmit Destinations_ table.
# Contract section has fields
a. Contract dropdown

* Changing the contract changes the information displayed in the Contract subsection to match the selected contract.
* Calendar can extend beyond today's date.

b. "create new contract" button
c. Info subsection has fields

* Region dropdown populated by _Region_ table.
* Non-Exclusivity is a Boolean Flag.
* Extra Innings is a Boolean Flag.

d. General Restrictions subsection has fields

* Games per Week is an integer.
* Games per Month is an integer.
* Games per Season is an integer.

e. Special Rules subsection has

* Special Rule field.
* Populated by additions to the "add rule" button.

f. Regular Season Days of the Week Restrictions subsection has fields

* Days with Restrictions dropdown with all seven days in menu.
* Fully Restricted is a Boolean Flag for _Monday_ and _Sunday_.
* Before is a timestamp.
* After is a timestamp.
* # of Total Games is an integer.

g. Jewel Event Broadcast Rights}} is a dropdown populated by the _Jewel Events_ table.
h. Restricted Broadcasters}}{color:#bf2600} {color}is a dropdown populated by the _Broadcasters_ field.
i. Shows field displays.
j. Countries is directly linked to countries table.

2. Updates made to rows/values in displayed Settings table are made to the corresponding reference table.
3. Active is True/False, represented by checked/unchecked.

title: Admin || Settings - Functionality
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to interact with the various broadcaster, event, and transmission details, so that I can add/edit/manipulate the information used across the various Intl BATTER fields.

Zeplin Link: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df60ef965f09bd4307a898] 

*AC*

# Clicking/tapping "Create New" button opens a drawer
a. Active field defaults _active_.
b. Drawer is specific to the Settings screen selected.

* NOTE: These specifications will be outlined in linked tickets for the Settings screen options.

c. Clicking/tapping "Save" and "Cancel" in the drawer completes the user's intended action.

# Clicking/tapping the Settings screen dropdown displays options
a. Country
b. Client Broadcaster
c. Jewel Event
d. Network
e. Postseason Series
f. Region
g. Transmit Circuit
h. Transmit Format
i. Transmit Destination
j. Transmit Decoder Brand
k. Transmit Decoder
l. Transmit Method

* In alphabetical order.

# Clicking/tapping an option in the Settings screen dropdown displays the table for the selected value.
a. Clicking/tapping a column header sorts the table by that column.

* Clicking/tapping the column again will sort the table the opposite way.
* Defaults Ascending.

# "Search" defaults empty.
a. Accepts freeform text.
b. Surfaces line items with matching keywords.
c. Does not reset any top rail filter that has a non-default value selected.

# Clicking/tapping "Active"/"Inactive" filters the table by the Active column.
a. Clicking/tapping "Active" surfaces rows that have the active flag.
b. Clicking/tapping "Inactive" surfaces rows that do not have the active flag.

# Clicking/tapping the _pencil icon_ opens an editable drawer of the corresponding row.
a. Same as the Create New drawer, but with appropriate answers filled out.
b. Clicking/tapping "Save" and "Cancel" complete the user's intended action.
c. Editing a row and clicking "Save" triggers the "Saved" confirmation message.
d. A successful save will push changes made to a line item throughout the system.
e. A failed save will result in error messaging.

# Clicking/tapping the _trash icon_ opens a confirmation modal.
a. Clicking/tapping "Delete" and "Cancel" complete the user's intended action.
b. A successful delete will remove the line item from future use throughout the system.

* Any reference to the line item (with regards to historical contracts, etc.) will continue to display, but will not be interactive.

c. Clicking/tapping the _trash icon_ on a row and clicking "Delete" triggers the Deleted confirmation message.
d. A failed delete will result in error messaging.

# Table has vertical scroll.

title: Admin || Edit Client Broadcaster - Countries Field Functionality
custom_steps:
As a member of MLBi, I want to interact with the Countries field, so that I can assign client broadcasters to specific countries.

_Zeplin:_ [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960] 

*AC*

1. When typing into the Search bar, only Countries that appear in the _Country_ Settings table should display as matching search results. 
a. _Country Table:_ [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2125] 
b. Selecting a country from the search adds that Country to the Countries field below.
c. Making a selection from the Search hides search dropdown. ( _NOTE:_ this AC only applies if we decide to do dropdown as opposed to workflow in zeplin.)

2. Upon creating a new Client Broadcasters, Countries field remains empty.
a. _NOTE:_ stakeholders want to select as needed, rather than deselect.
3. Clicking/tapping the "X" deselects the respective Country from the Countries field.
4. After three lines in the {{Countries}} field, field has vertical scroll.


_NOTE:_ User will not be able to add Countries from this page.

title: Admin || Edit Client Broadcaster - Create Feeds Table
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to assign Feeds to a Client Broadcaster, so that they can only tap into feeds I pre-approve.



*AC*

1. Feed table displays. Columns include:
a. Game/Event Type - Required, single-select of items selected in the Game Types and Jewel Events fields.
b. Home -  Not Required - Single-select dropdown of all MLB teams.
c. Away -  Not Required - Single-select dropdown of all MLB teams.
d. Feeds - Required - Multi-select dropdown of following feeds: Canada, LatAm, Japan, Europe, World Feed

2. All feeds selected in the Feeds column display in the Preferred Networks field in addition to the assigned Networks for games that meet the restrictions set in Game/Event Type, Home, and Away columns.
a. EX) In the below screenshot, SammyTV will see all Networks assigned to Regular Season Dodgers games, regardless of the Away team, in addition to _World Feed_ and _Japan Feed_.

3. If value in Game/Event Type column has no pre-assigned networks, only the selected Feeds will display in the Client Broadcaster's Preferred Network field.
a. Feeds display at top of dropdown menu.

4. "Add Feed" button displays beneath the table.
a. Clicking/tapping creates an empty line item in the table.



![](index.php?/attachments/get/14593141)

title: Admin || Edit Client Broadcaster - Create Game Types Field
custom_steps:
As a member of MLBi, I want to interact with the Game Types field, so that I can assign client broadcasters to specific games and jewel events.

*AC*

1. Game Types multi-select dropdown is added to the Jewel Events & Game Types subsection.
2. All game type categories in BATTER display in this dropdown.
a. i.e. _Regular Season, Postseason,_ and _Spring Training_ are added to the field dropdown.

3. Client Broadcasters can only request game types that are selected in this field.
a. EX) If regular season is not selected, all regular season games will be grayed out in the Client Broadcaster's Requests calendar.


![](index.php?/attachments/get/14593142)

title: Admin || Edit Client Broadcaster - Display Restrictions as Sentences
custom_steps:
As a member of MLBi, I want to see Days of the Week Restrictions written out, so that I can make sure I'm setting rules accurately.

_Zeplin:_ [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960] 



*AC*

1. Display rules in day order displayed in the {{Days with Restrictions}} field.
2. If a day is checked as Fully Restricted, display [Day Name] - Fully Restricted
a. Day Name is corresponding unabbreviated Day.

3. If a day has a Before restriction, display [Day Name] - No games before [time]
a. Day Name is corresponding unabbreviated Day.
b. Time is value inputted into the Before field.

4. If a day has an After restriction, display [Day Name] - No games after [time]
a. Day Name is unabbreviated Day.
b. Time is value inputted into the After field.

5. If a day has a # of Total Games restriction, display [Day Name] - [number] games total
a. Day Name is unabbreviated Day.
b. Number is value inputted into the # of Total Games field.

title: Admin || Edit Client Broadcaster - Signage Path Field Functionality
custom_steps:
As a member of MLBi, I want to interact with the Signage Path field, so that I can assign client broadcasters to specific signage paths.

*AC*

1. Signage Path field is multi-select.
2. When typing into the Search bar, only signage paths that appear in the _Signage Path_ Settings table should display as matching search results. 
a. Selecting a signage path from the search adds that path to the Signage Path field.
b. -Making a selection from the Search hides search dropdown.-

3. Upon creating a new Client Broadcaster, Signage Path field remains empty.
a. _NOTE:_ stakeholders want to select as needed, rather than deselect.

4. Clicking/tapping the "X" deselects the respective signage paths from the Signage Path field.
5. After three lines in the Signage Path field, field has vertical scroll.

6. Only values selected for in this field will populate in the Signage Path field of a game request summary drawer for a Request Approver.
a. EX) If SammyTV has only ASG - Asia in the Signage Path field, when a Request Approver is approving/denying one of SammyTV's game requests, the Signage Path field dropdown will only display ASG - Asia.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14593143)

title: Request Approver || Edit Client Broadcaster Profile - Add "In Between" Field
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to restrict Network game requests within a time period, so that we can continue to limit their requests in accordance with their contracts.

_Zeplin:_ [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67dc3da2ef4c49aa43a56fe0|https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67dc3da2ef4c49aa43a56fe0|smart-link] 



*AC*

# Wireframes of first option are implemented.
# _In Between_ field displays above _Before_ field. 
## Two time fields display separated by a hyphen.
## Field is a dropdown with values of times separated by 15 minutes. 
# _Before_, _After_, and  _# of Total Games_ fields are wider.
## New width matches the width of the _In Between_ field.
# Selecting a range in the _In Between_ field restricts a Client Broadcaster from selecting games within that inclusive time period.
# If a value is first selected for the first field, then the first dropdown value displayed in the second field is 15 minutes after the time selected in the first.
## EX) User selects 5 PM in first field, dropdown values displayed in second field are [5:15, 12).
# If a value is first selected for the second field, then the last dropdown value displayed in the first field is 15 minutes before the time selected in the second.
## EX) User selects 5 PM in second field, dropdown values displayed in first field are (12, 4:45].
# â€œIn Betweenâ€� values display as â€œNo games in between [start time] and [end time].â€� in the text summary.
# Verified on Beta by Test.
# Sent to Product for UAT.
# Shipped to Prod with BATTER release.

title: When editing broadcaster, include a way to easily identify fields that are missing that prevent user from saving
custom_steps: Currently in Dev, the broadcaster Mckervin-Test can not be saved after edits are made due to a missing field.  We should highlight missing fields to make it easier for the user to determine which fields need to be completed before a save is allowed.  (i.e. red outline, etc)
